results.title: A Blind teacher in a public school (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Henry Felt, David Ticchi and Graduate School of Education, Harvard University
results.brief_description: Shows how one blind man, David Ticchi, carries out his daily responsibilities as a full-time teacher of English. He is seen performing normal tasks required of a classroom teacher, and when interviewed, he explains his teaching methods. Explores the peculiar advantages a blind teacher may bring to a sighted classroom. Includes interviews with David Ticchi’s students and colleagues.

results.title: A Blind child and a sighted child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Selma H. Fraiberg and University of Michigan. Audio-Visual Education Center
results.brief_description: Follows a blind and a sighted child through the sensori-motor period during the first year of life in an attempt to answer the following questions. How is this crucial period affected when one of the major senses is lacking? What are the pathways of progress for the blind infant? What are the limits set by his handicap?

results.title: A Bird of prey: the red-tailed hawk
results.creator_credit: Edward C. Harris and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Examines the life cycle of a red-tailed hawk. Shows the physical qualities that help the hawk to survive. Establishes the importance of the red-tailed hawk in maintaining ecological balance. Conveys the reasons for the hawk’s decline in numbers.

results.title: A Bird's eye view
results.creator_credit: Roger Whittaker, ABC-TV (Australia) and Roger Whittaker Films
results.brief_description: The Kookaburra and the Magpie are two of our national icons. Everyone recognises the Kookaburra by its laugh, but in ‘Kookaburra’, its fascinating social system is revealed as well as its expert fishing abilities. The Magpie has a beautiful call but can be aggressive and territorial. The complete life cycle of this common but fascinating bird is explored in ‘Magpie’.

results.title: A Bill of divorcement. Ruby Gentry
results.creator_credit: King Vidor, George Cukor, Joseph Bernhard, David O. Selznick, Bernhard-Vidor Productions and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: A Bill of divorcement: Katharine Hepburn’s debut in what was to be the first film in a long association with director George Cukor. Hillary Fairfield (John Barrymore), shellshocked during World War One, escapes from the asylum on the day his ex-wife is to remarry. Unable to adjust, he must also confront his now grown-up daughter Sydney (katharine Hepburn). Facing reality, he finally accepts his wife’s determination to marry a sane, healthy man, but does not know of the impending sacrifice his daughter is to make. Sydney knows that the streak of madness in her father is inherited, not war-induced and, fearful of passing it on to her children, she cancels her marriage in order to care for her father. Cast also includes Billie Burke and David Manners. Ruby Gentry: Jennifer Jones stars as Ruby, a young southern woman from a poor white-trash family determined to improve her lot in life by marrying into wealth even though she is romantically involved with Boake Tackman (Charlton Heston) who too is from the “wrong” side of the tracks. So when successful businessman Jim Gentry (Karl Malden) finds himself totally in love with Ruby and insists on making her his wife, Ruby, of course, cannot resist this fortuitous offer. However, for Gentry it will turn out to be a most unfortunate decision with dire consequences. Cast also includes Tom Tully and James Anderson.

results.title: A Bike, a birthday
results.brief_description: Almost every young child longs for a shiny new bike. One youngster, Jay, wishes for and has a marvellous adventure in his dream about this prize possession. But until the morning of his birthday, Jay doesn’t know whether or not his birthday gift is the treasured first bike. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: A Big hand for everyone
results.creator_credit: Michel Pearce and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: The average man, in ignorance and confusion, has an optimistic view of his future. The expert, wrapped in his knowledge and expertise, is pessimistic. It is this disparity of belief that the political cartoonist and humorist, Bruce Petty, animates in his film. Petty sees the world and its problems as complex. He shows Man as a lonely figure on a unicycle, pedalling hard towards disaster. Awards: Golden Reel Award, AFI Awards 1971.

results.title: A Big country
results.creator_credit: Roland Litchfield and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Throughout Australia aluminium is being used more and more in a multitude of industries and particularly in transport. Across vast tracts of country aluminium road transports, buses, railway carriages, and aeroplanes fly daily. Fishing boats and pleasure craft, caravans and land are all now produced in aluminium. Tip trucks, plank floor trays and wheat hoppers, as well as domestic items such as foil have all been affected by the “aluminium revolution”.

results.title: A Better way
results.brief_description: In order to keep Canada’s vast quantities of mail moving, Canada Post dug around for a suitable solution. They came up with MAPP (Major Area Postal Plant), an ingenious, highly complex, streamlined system that relies on the postal code for efficient operation. The postal code relies on you and me, the mailing public, for inclusion in the address. The film tells what happens when a piece of mail is set on its course. No other credits available.
